intro: Ophiopogon wallichianus var. leucanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered spathiphyllum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Himalayas. It features dense, dark green foliage with a fibrous root system, typical of the Asparagaceae family. The plant produces striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer, forming clustered spikes. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often used in ornamental gardening. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
